data.title: Fun!
data.text: This is now called Solidarity. Same place. Same food. Reviewed it recently. It's fun. Eat outside in the back for a better experience.

data.title: Feels like home far away from home
data.text: I was surprised to find polish restaurant in a very centre of Santa Monica. Food was awesome. Service was superb. For a while I felt like at my Granny's home.

data.title: New name/new colors/newdecor
data.text: I find this place just ok. Patio is charming but to noisy when many people. If you were doing well why would you overnight change the front of the restaurant to a totally different look and change the name. You say the food is the same and you really are still Warszawa ??? huh? Am I missing something here?

data.title: SMALL PORTIONS and New Menu
data.text:
We love Polish food and we loved , yes, LOVED Warszawa.
Solidarity is WARSZAWA under new management .

The portions are small ! 
We ordered Golombki and it came is a tiny scoop of mashed potatoes. Seriously folks, this is Polish food. Should you have to walk out hungry?
Its not cheap and that's OK BUT don't make the portions sooooo SMALL.

The vibe is cool and the polish food drinks are very very good.

Sadly, we will not be back. We felt Ripped-off

data.title: I liked it!
data.text: I have been at this place twice already and I can tell these people know what they do. very authentic polish food, great atmosphere, and friendly servers. and prices are reasonably fare  based on the location.

data.title: Great Polish food!
data.text: I am an older east coast Polish-american with much family experience with east coast style polish food. I will tell you this is different, for the better in my opinion. Loved the zcrasy and golabki. The mizeria was to die for. Pierogis excellent. Potato pancakes awesome. Portions rightsized, thank you. The topper was the lounge out back for an after dinner bison grass martini. Service +10, music +10, atmosphere +10. Recommended.

data.title: Don't bother--too expensive and quality of food not the greatest!
data.text:
Do yourself a favor and do not come to this place.
Santa Monica has many other good restaurants that all you have to do is select the type of food and go.  My friend and I went there but only the service was not great, the food was ok but not great so certainly I will not recommend this polish restaurant as both of us made an error to pick this restaurant!!  Save yourself a hassle!!

data.title: Authentic Polish Cooking
data.text:
Savory Polish dishes in a friendly atmosphere.  A restaurant of long-standing in Santa Monica.  One does well to sample the  stroganoff:  beef stewed with wild mushrooms served over spaetzle (a kind of pasta).  Their  nalesniki:
savory crepes, spinach or wild mushroom also tasty.

data.title: Choosing what to order here will take time.
data.text: Invited to dinner by local friends when we visited, we were advised to try the excellent Long Island duck. Slow roasting crisped the skin, as touted, but also dried the meat. If this were Peking Duck, it might not have been too bad, but even the usually moist dark meat suffered. My wife tried the Beef Stroganoff, which was reduced to a pulpy texture, and lacked any depth of flavor. Accompanying spaetzle and vegetables were good. Appetizers of fried pierogis and bacon wrapped prunes were lip-smackers. The introductory polish cocktails, including the Warszawa Llama, the polish version of the Moscow Mule, were unattractive. Wine list was mediocre, with no vintages listed. Setting and service are good. After a few visits, you can certainly find favorite dishes, but, is it worth it?

data.title: Outdoor dining with Polish food
data.text: The outdoor area of Warszawa is lovely and cool.   We got there too late for Happy Hour, but loved the Bison Grass Vodka martini.   A Polish specialty, this vodka is truly special.  We also enjoyed duck pate, two kinds of steamed pierogis - mushroom potato and beef carrot.   Prices are mid-range, but the unusual menu is well prepared and well worth it.   Parking is a difficult but if you go east of the restaurant, it gets easier.   Service was great.

data.title: WOW, amazing meal
data.text: The restaurant is very nice inside.  It is divided into a number of rooms so this keeps the noise at a minimal level.  All the staff are friendly and helpful in explaining the dishes.  Be sure to start with some of their pierogies.  They are all homemade and absolutely amazing.  In fact, all their dishes are homemade and absolutely wonderful.  The wine list is compact but a nice broad range and the prices are good.  A wonderful meal!

data.title: Good Food at L.A.'s only Polish Restaurant
data.text: Went to Warzawa again with a visiting Polish-American acquaintance recently.  The food here is solid, basic Polish classic dishes, and he seemed pleased.  Portions seem generous, but nothing too surprising on the menu--just classics.  Love the Buffalo Grass Vodka (and associated cocktails).  The service is very helpful and friendly.  The environment is cozy, not too loud.  I've been several times before and will no doubt go again.

data.title: Latkes the way Mama made them
data.text: There are only a few restaurants in Los Angeles that make real from scratch potato pancakes.  These are really good.

data.title: Always had an excellent experience at this restaurant
data.text: I and family and friends have eaten at this restaurant many times over the years.  Collectively, I have been at this restaurant more than thirty times.  The restaurant is not the typical restaurant found in most American cities; it is an authentic Polish restaurant.  The menu is authentic Polish cuisine.  The prices are not cheap but they are not high, either.  I call the prices, reasonable.  The selection of items on the menu is never disappointing.  The building that houses the restaurant is not attractive from the outside.  It is an old building on a busy street.  I was told that the building was, many years ago, a family home.  The layout of the restaurant certainly gives the impression that it was formerly a home.  For example, instead of having a large room as the  restaurant, there are several individual rooms with dining tables.  I hope this place stays in business many more years as I intend to visit it many times more in the future.  I highly recommend the restaurant.

data.title: Polish/Eastern European Restaurant
data.text: This is not strictly Polish food. You will find schnitzel, spaetzle, and other foods if you are not into stuffed cabbage, pierogis, potato pancakes, etc. But love yourself for a meal and enjoy as many food options as you can. We were there in a group of 6 so we shared several starters and mains. The waitress was wonderful. She knew the 6 of us were sharing the starters so she added a couple of potato pancakes so we could each try one. We all have an opinion about certain food items and they live in our minds as having been outstanding. That said, I have had better chicken paprikash, and the spaetzle were (for some reason) kinda mushed up. My mom made potato pancakes that were not so flat and smooth so I like hers better. All that aside, the food was delicious. Stroganoff was exceptional, so was the stuffed cabbage (although a bit sweet for me,) pierogis outstanding (don't miss those, at least.) One friend tried the tripe and loved it but he did not share (nor would we have asked, acquired taste.) Portions were very large, we should have shared more plates as it was painful to leave such good food behind. Very small wine list, you won't be here to focus on trying out new wines. Restaurant is not inexpensive, but for Santa Monica, I felt it was reasonable. With tip, two bottles of wine, and way too much food it ran to about $85 a couple.

data.title: Polish cuisine like my Mother made
data.text: I was taken here for my birthday . My brother was visiting from out of town. The food was like our Mother used to make. The ambiance, service and food were all outstanding. It is a small restaurant  but there were tables for parties of 6 and even 10 set up. You do need reservations

data.title: Great Happy Hour
data.text:
Met with the UC Berkeley Alumni there. Place has an outdoor patio in the back (surprise) -  great prices for Happy Hour for drinks and food.
Fun area to meet in. Kinda well kept secret

data.title: Food taste is great, small portions and horrible cashier
data.text:
The food for sure definitely quite authentic, beer is great, as I have been to many E Europe countries hence I can tell even I m not a polish but several cons:

1. Portion is small for American standard especially the appetizer, like its potato pancake, only 4 small slices.  Side dish for roast duck charging $24 before tax and tips is also too less
2. Menu is kept changing from time to time, the side dish is different from what I saw in yelp.
3. Maybe Chinese look all the same (mainlanders are notoriously for bad manners during travel to museums and tourist spots but famous for buying huge volume of luxurious goods with guanxi money), the cashier asked if I paid 20 bucks less while I counted twice before I give the money to her.   I asked her to recount again.  She then apologize.  But This is really bad, though I think the food is great, I won't go back to eat again forever, this is the same horrible experience I found in many places in Singapore.   No other restaurants in the States even doubted me like this.

I am really disappointed.  I sincerely hope that it will not happen again to other Chinese-looking tourists.  I took out 2 stars as a result.

data.title: Expand your dining with a delicious visit to Warsaw and Polish cuisine
data.text: What a terrific place to dine. Located in a beautiful old house and decorated like something right out of Warsaw with old world touches but modern beautiful Polish art on the walls. Seating in several dining rooms that feel like you might be in Europe. That is the backdrop now on to the great menu that offers dinners a wide range of the delicious recipes from Poland. Great appetizers, excellent entrees, perfect desserts if you have room to get to them. Out table had a variety of pierogies( must try them) soup- out of this world and then on to entrees. Many selections so our table had trout simmered with leeks and tomatoes, another dinner the schnitzel and others opting for the special scallops for that evening. yes- sumptuous servings with perfect sides of vegetables/ potato/other starch  all included. Generous portions of well prepared food. Service was lovely and all dining seemed very pleased with their meal and the ambiance of this must try place. I understand they have a great variety of vodka as well for those who are looking for high quality spirits. Eager to take friends there to see what they have been missing.

data.title: Planning to become a regular.
data.text: We wanted to try something different and it was delightful.  Got a salad sampler for the table and that was devoured by four people in no time.  Ordered a second and we gobbled it up.  Next, pickle soup.  I had no reason to be nervous - it was delicious.  Also great were the lamb dumplings, the pieroghi - have no idea how to spell this - which were unbelievably flavorful.  Tonya, our server, was really good.  Made us feel right at home and checked in on us the right number of times.  Also made good wine recommendations.  Excellent service and charming ambiance.
